title: House Votes to End Mandatory Arbitration
text:
Text size

Leon Neal/Getty Images

Clauses in most brokerage contracts call for mandatory arbitration when disputes arise, and they’re showing up in more advisory contracts.

But the House passed legislation Friday that would render those clauses void, InvestmentNews reports.

The Forced Arbitration Injustice Repeal Act, or Fair Act, which passed largely along party lines, would prohibit predispute arbitration agreements for consumer, employment, antitrust, or civil rights claims, the publication notes.
description: The Fair Act would prohibit mandatory arbitration in brokerage and advisory contracts but is unlikely to make it through the Republican-controlled Senate.
